questions.question_text: What are two characteristics of RPC API calls? (Choose two.)

choices.E: They call a single function or service.
choices.C: Parameters can be passed to the calls.
choices.B: They use only UDP for communications.
choices.A: They can be used only on network devices.

discussion.content: In my view, correct ans should be C & E

comments.content: As an experienced software architect i confirm C and E to be correct.

discussion.content: I would agree with C & E, the API calls are like function calls, you make a single function call and pass parameters. Seeing how it's an API format, it could be used on a number of things, not only network devices.

Selected Answer: E
This Exam is no longer Valid. There are all new questions

Selected Answer: A
All questions are out of date!

Selected Answer: E
all exam questions are outdated
Just in case, none of the questions are on the current exam as of October 1st

comments.content: Could you please share with us your experience? Did you pass? What kind of questions did the exam had?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
C & E is correct answer.
Answers are C and E
Definetely C and E

Selected Answer: CE
It should be C and E

Selected Answer: CE
A [wrong] - RPC calls can be used on all devices supporting RPC, not just network devices
B [wrong] - RPC calls can use SSH too
C [true] - paramteres can be passed to RPC calls
D [wrong] - as RPC calls can use SSH, dont have to use SSL/TLS
E [true] - RPC calls call a function or service

Selected Answer: CE
RPC client applications can use Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security (SSL/TLS) as the transport medium, but this is not a requirement. In my opinion, C and E are more likely for this question.

I not sure is E correct or not.
As "Batching Remote Procedure Calls" can call more than one RPC. E seem not correct?

comments.content:
I think the last line of B3nd2cida must be "so by discard ...E gets in" 
This is the best explanation so far. So I will go with C and E

discussion.content:
Definitely, not A. It can be execute in traditional Servers. 

Not B. It work in TCP as well https://www.w3.org/History/1992/nfs_dxcern_mirror/rpc/doc/User/Internet.html

The RPC request message contains the remote procedure parameters tor the procedure to be execute at the server(remote) end. So C is OK.

RPC can run over TLS. There is an RFC for it. So not D.

So by discard ... D gets in.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the code from the bottom onto the box where the code is missing in the Ansible playbook to apply the configuration to an interface on a Cisco IOS
XE device. Not all options are used.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: IOS_Config, and Parents is correct
It should be ios_config and parents
Why is it Parent and not Interface?

Answer is BE.

You need the Webex Team access Token to interact with Webex Team API. 
Although is optional, you can configure a Meraki Webhook Secret to receive the post from the Meraki API.
Source: 
https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/webhooks/#!introduction/common-json-parameters
https://github.com/CiscoDevNet/meraki-code/blob/master/meraki-webhooks/webhookreceiver.py

It should be - BE
B - https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/guides/webhooks
E - https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/webhooks/#!introduction/common-json-parameters

Selected Answer: BE
B and E
